element.name: Perhipheral Nuclei of Midbrain Mesencephalon
element.notes: Sensory relay or direct motor control

element.name: Oculomotor Nucleus
element.function: Change Eye Direction
element.notes: Muscle nucleus

element.name: Caudal Central Oculomotor Nucleus
element.notes: levator palpebrae supeioris

element.name: Trochlear Nucleus
element.function: Control superior oblique muscles of eyes
element.notes: Muscle nucleus, change eye direction

element.name: Edinger-Westphal Nucleus
element.function: Change Eye Pupil
element.notes: Parasympathetic nucleus, parvocellular extention of OCN

element.name: Mesencephalic Trigeminal Nucleus
element.function: unconscious proprioception from muscle spindles; facial somatic sensations from muscles of mastication, monosynaptic masticatory reflex
element.notes: Lower, mandibular - ganglion; mandible and maxilla - tooth pulp, surrounding gingiva, periodontal membrane and a vast portion of the oral mucosa
element.comment: sensory neurons of masticatory muscles, the teeth, the mandibular joint, the mandible, the maxilla and the intraocular muscles; most to motor trigeminal, few - to principal trigeminal

element.name: Mesencephalic Reticular Formation
element.notes: Saccades, fixation, gaze holding and vergence. Space-time coordinated rapid eye movements

element.name: Cuneiform Nucleus
element.function: Passive coping strategy to novel, painful or threatening stimuli
element.notes: modulatory nucleus; medial part of midbrain RF

element.name: Median Raphe Nucleus
element.function: Block or temporarily suspend mnemonic processes in the hippocampus
element.notes: Directs HC to disregard insignificant events; inhibitory nucleus

element.name: Dorsal Raphe Nucleus
element.function: Regulation of sleep and mood
element.notes: Major source of 5HT; inhibitory nucleus

element.name: Raphe Interpositus Nucleus
element.function: Premotor network for saccades
element.notes: Gate activity of burst neurons for vertical and horizontal saccades

element.name: Reflexes Nuclei of Midbrain Mesencephalon
element.notes: Generate simple motor signal by sensory without cortex

element.name: Auditory Reflexes Nuclei of Midbrain Mesencephalon
element.notes: Control auditory muscles

element.name: Inferior Colliculus
element.function: Reflex centres of hearing

element.name: Superior Olivary Complex
element.function: Bilateral Audition
element.notes: Projections from both left and right ABA.CN

element.name: Visual Reflexes Nuclei of Midbrain Mesencephalon
element.notes: Control oculomotor muscles

element.name: Superior Colliculus
element.function: Direct behavioral responses toward specific points in egocentric space, induce saccadic eye movement
element.notes: Superficial layers are sensory-related, deep layers are motor-related

element.name: Superficial Superior Colliculus
element.function: Head and eye attention to visual stimuli
element.notes: Receive input primarily from the visual system and show primarily visual responses

element.name: Deep Superior Colliculus
element.function: Head and eye attention to non-visual stimuli
element.notes: Receive many types of input and project to numerous motor-related brain areas
unused subdivision
unused subdivision

element.refs: NL:[http://neurolex.org/wiki/Category:Rostral_half_of_the_superior_colliculus Rostral half of the superior colliculus]
element.notes: unused subdivision
unused subdivision

element.name: Supraoculomotor Area
element.function: Control of vergence
element.notes: Dorsal to OCN, send premotor commands to OCN

element.name: Cajal Nucleus
element.function: Integration of head and eye movements, controls downward vertical gaze
element.comments: Relay of extrapyramidal control for automatic movements
element.notes: Projects to CN3, CN4 nuclei, rotation of body about its long axis, Project to vestibular nuclei

element.name: Rostral Interstitial Nucleus of MLF
element.function: Integration of head and eye movements, controls upward vertical gaze

element.name: Darkschewitsch Nucleus
element.function: Mediate the consensual pupillary light reflex
element.notes: Light in one eye results in pupil changes in another eye

element.name: Anterior Pretectum Nucleus
element.function: Mediate somatosensory and nociceptive information
element.notes: 3 parallel flows from MC, anterior interpositus nucleus of TH, GR to dorsal accessory IO

element.name: Nucleus of Optic Tract
element.function: Encode retinal error information during smooth pursuit eye movements
element.notes: Guide motor learning during horizontal SP; ipsilateral horizontal ocular pursuit

element.name: Pretectal Olivary Nucleus
element.function: Pupillary light reflex and modulating subcortical nuclei involved in circadian rhythms
element.notes: Primary visual centre, involved in the pupillary light reflex, receives retinal input

element.name: Principal Pretectal Nucleus
element.function: Pupillary light reflex
element.notes: Affected by visual cortex and projects to EWN

element.name: Sublentiform Nucleus
element.function: Accomodation reflex
element.notes: Combines visual cortex and retinal input to project to OCN, receives retinal input

element.name: Red Nucleus
element.function: Motor coordination
element.notes: Crawling of babies is controlled by RN

element.name: Periaqueductal Gray Matter
element.function: Descending modulation of pain and in defensive behaviour
element.notes: if there is a lesion in the PAG, then consciousness is lost; electrical stimulation of the PAG results in immediate and profound analgesia; modulatory nucleus

element.name: Ventral Tegmental Area
element.function: Respond to novel stimuli, unexpected rewards, and reward predictive sensory cues

element.name: Abducens Nucleus
element.function: Conjugated movements of both eyes
element.notes: Motoneurons - to muscle, interneurons - to OCN

element.name: Barrington's Nucleus
element.function: Supraspinal regulation of urination
element.notes: Sends projections to Sacral Precerebellar Nucleus

element.name: Cerebellum
element.function: Motor coordination
element.notes: Deep Nuclei and cerebellum cortex

element.name: Lateral Part of Anterior Interposed Nucleus
element.refs: NL:[http://neurolex.org/wiki/Category:Lateral_part_of_the_anterior_interposed_nucleus Lateral part of the anterior interposed nucleus]

element.name: Facial Motor Nucleus
element.function: Control of face

element.name: Incertus Nucleus
element.function: Behavioural activation and the response to stress
element.notes: Modulating influences on prefrontal and hippocampal cortical activity, midline behavior control; modulatory nucleus

element.name: Laterodorsal Tegmental Nucleus
element.function: Modulating sustained attention or in mediating alerting responses

element.name: Locus Coeruleus
element.function: Regulate the intensity of responses to salient stimuli
element.notes: NE Source, enhance signal-to-noise ratio, suppressing irrelevant stimuli (lateral inhibition); inhibitory nucleus

element.name: Parabrachial Nucleus
element.function: Source of short-latency nociceptive input

element.name: Pedunculopontine Nucleus
element.function: Provide sensory feedback to cerebral cortex; modulatory

element.name: Pontobulbar Body
element.function: Control voluntary muscle activities
element.notes: Walking, speaking, breathing, part of corticopontocerebellar pathway

element.name: Rostral Pontine Nucleus
element.function: Part of learning, motivation, spatial memory pathway
element.notes: Relay from mammillary body to CR

element.name: Kolliker-Fuse Nucleus
element.function: Control of protruder tongue muscles contraction to maintain respiration
element.notes: To hypoglossal nucleus and phrenic nucleus

element.name: Nuclei of Lateral Lemniscus
element.function: Decoding of amplitude modulated sounds
element.notes: Prominent columnar organization, cochlea to IC

element.name: Nucleus Subceruleus
element.function: Tongue control
element.notes: To hypoglossal nucleus

element.name: Oral Pontine Reticular Nucleus
element.function: Mediation of changing to and from REM sleep
element.notes: Part of horizontal gaze center, projects to spinal cord and abducens

element.name: Caudal Pontine Reticular Nucleus
element.function: Mediate head movements
element.notes: Grinding of the teeth in sleep, projections from superior colliculus, to spinal cord, extends to facial

element.name: Pontine Reticulotegmental Nucleus
element.function: Mediate saccadic eye movements
element.notes: Inactivation leads to deficit of expression, but not learning
element.comments: Nucleus of Bechterew, tegmentopontine reticular nucleus, projections from superior colliculus

element.name: Parvocellular Reticular Nucleus
element.function: Flow of respiratory current out of organism
element.notes: Projects to facial nucleus, hypoglossal nucleus and parabrachial nucleus

element.name: Pontine Raphe Nucleus
element.function: Regulation of sleep cycle
element.notes: Projects to CR, forebrain; inhibitory nucleus

element.name: Nucleus Linearis
element.function: Release of 5-HT was only obtained on stimulation of this nucleus
element.notes: Does not project to CR, but to forebrain

element.name: Superior Central Raphe Nucleus
element.notes: Insomnia; inhibitory nucleus

element.name: Principal Trigeminal Nucleus
element.refs: NL:[http://neurolex.org/wiki/Category:Principal_sensory_nucleus_of_trigeminal_nerve Principal sensory nucleus of trigeminal nerve]
element.function: Facial Somatic Sensations
element.notes: Upper, maxillary, ophthalmic

element.name: Trigeminal Motor Nucleus
element.function: Muscles of first branchial arch
element.notes: Pontine Nuclei, lower face and jaw control, Motor Nucleus of V n.

element.name: Vestibular Nucleus
element.function: Equilibrium, Postural Reflexes

element.name: Inferior Vestibular Nuclei
element.function: maintain balance, coordinating postural adjustments
element.notes: to CR; to oculomotor, trochlear, abducens, accessory oculomotor

element.name: Lateral Vestibular Nuclei
element.function: controlling body position
element.notes: to sacral, ipsilateral - lateral vestibulospinal tract

element.name: Medial Vestibular Nucleus
element.function: controlling head position, integrate head and eye movements; maintain balance, coordinating postural adjustments; coordination for horizontal eye movements
element.notes: to thoracic, bilateral - medial vestibulospinal tract in MLF; to CR; to oculomotor, trochlear, abducens, accessory oculomotor

element.name: Superior Vestibular Nuclei
element.function: conscious perception of movement and gravity
element.notes: to oculomotor, trochlear, abducens, accessory oculomotor; to VPI

element.name: Vestibular Ganglion
element.function: Contact with hair cells of vestibular sensory end organs
element.notes: Scarpas ganglion

element.name: Accessory Cuneate Nucleus
element.function: receives input from cervical spinal nerves and transmits that information to cerebellum
element.notes: upper extremity equivalent of Clarke's column

element.name: Expiratory Center
element.notes: Ventral Respiratory Group, sends inhibitory impulse to the apneustic centre

element.name: Ambiguus Nucleus
element.function: Control muscles of pharynx
element.notes: On par with VGM, speech

element.name: Retroambigualis Nucleus
element.function: Groups of premotor interneurons producing detailed motor actions
element.notes: Different combination of activation of these premotor neurons determines vocalization, vomiting, coughing, sneezing, mating posture, or child delivery

element.name: Arcuate Nucleus of Medulla
element.function: Controlling respiratory frequency
element.notes: Receives fibers from spitothalamic tract and sends to CR

element.name: Cochlear Nucleus
element.function: Divergence in representation of auditory information
element.notes: Carry sound information from organ of Corti

element.name: Cuneate Nucleus
element.function: Carry fine touch and proprioceptive information from upper body

element.name: Gracile Nucleus
element.function: Carry epicritic, kinesthetic, and conscious proprioceptive information from lower body

element.name: Hypoglossal Motor Nucleus
element.function: Control of tongue

element.name: Inferior Olivary Nucleus
element.function: Proprioception Relay from Spinal Cord to Cerebellum

element.name: Rostral Portion of Medial Accessory Olive
element.refs: NL:[http://neurolex.org/wiki/Category:Rostral_portion_of_the_medial_accessory_olive Rostral portion of the medial accessory olive]

element.name: Intercalated Nucleus of Medulla
element.function: Coordinate tongue movements, vestibuloocular reflex
element.notes: Receives sensory inputs from neck region

element.name: Medullary Reticular Formation
element.function: Somatic motor control, cardiovascular control, pain modulation, sleep and consciousness, habituation
element.notes: 100 small neural networks, habituation - sleep in load city but awake from crying baby

element.name: Gigantocellular Reticular Nucleus
element.function: Mediate head movements
element.notes: Projects to hypoglossal nucleus, abducens

element.name: Prepositus Nucleus
element.function: Integrate PPRF phasic signal to provide tonic signal of abducens
element.notes: Part of horizontal gaze holding system

element.name: Raphe Nucleus of Medulla
element.function: Regulate moods, temper anxiety, and relieve depression
element.notes: Releases 5HT (serotonin) hormone (happiness); inhibitory nucleus

element.name: Inferior Salivatory Nucleus
element.function: facilitate digestion - produce watery saliva
element.notes: preganglionic parasympathetic nucleus; project to otic ganglion to parotid gland; to gut ganglia, to pulmonary ganglia

element.name: Superior Salivatory Nucleus
element.function: facilitate respiration - produce thiker saliva
element.notes: preganglionic parasympathetic nucleus; project to submaxillary (submandibular) ganglion to submandibular/sublingual gland; to sphenopalatine ganglion to superior maxillary nerve as vasodilator and secretory fibers to the mucous membrane of the nose, soft palate, tonsils, uvula, roof of the mouth, upper lips and gums, parotid and orbital glands

element.name: Solitary Nucleus
element.function: Carry taste buds, thoracic and abdominal viscera
element.notes: c.n. VII, IX, X

element.name: Medial Nucleus Tractus Solitarius
element.refs: NL:[http://neurolex.org/wiki/Category:Medial_nucleus_of_the_solitary_tract Medial nucleus of the solitary tract]

element.name: Medial Part of Nucleus of Solitary Tract
element.refs: NL:[http://neurolex.org/wiki/Category:Medial_part_of_the_nucleus_of_the_solitary_tract Medial part of the nucleus of the solitary tract]

element.name: Rostral Nucleus of Solitary Tract
element.refs: NL:[http://neurolex.org/wiki/Category:Rostral_nucleus_of_the_solitary_tract Rostral nucleus of the solitary tract]

element.name: Spinal Trigeminal Nucleus
element.function: Discriminative sensation and light touch of face, conscious proprioception
element.notes: Pontine Nuclei, part of cranial nerve nuclei, ear

element.name: Trigeminal Caudal Nucleus
element.refs: NL:[http://neurolex.org/wiki/Category:Caudal_part_of_spinal_trigeminal_nucleus Caudal part of spinal trigeminal nucleus]

element.name: Interpolar Part of Spinal Trigeminal Nucleus
element.refs: NL:[http://neurolex.org/wiki/Category:Interpolar_part_of_spinal_trigeminal_nucleus Interpolar part of spinal trigeminal nucleus]

element.name: Oral Part of Spinal Trigeminal Nucleus
element.refs: NL:[http://neurolex.org/wiki/Category:Oral_part_of_spinal_trigeminal_nucleus Oral part of spinal trigeminal nucleus]

element.name: Paratrigeminal Nucleus
element.function: Orofacial nociceptive sensory processing
element.notes: Somatosensory reflex, site for nociceptive inputs from sciatic innervation field

element.name: Peritrigeminal Nucleus
element.notes: Project to thermosensitive neurons of medial preoptic area

element.name: Vagus Nucleus
element.refs: NL:[http://neurolex.org/wiki/Category:Dorsal_motor_nucleus_of_vagus_nerve Dorsal motor nucleus of vagus nerve]
element.function: Parasympathetic vagal functions in the gastrointestinal tract, lungs
element.notes: Dorsal Motor Nucleus, Cardioinhibitory Center; preganglionic nucleus
